vectors.text: Eryk Orłowski — Design leader and builder. Pioneered usability in Poland (2003). Built large-scale design systems at ING. Now building AI-powered systems (agentic RAG pipelines, MCP servers, hireverse.app). Philosophy: What I do today, the industry does in 5 years.

Sportradar (2022–2025) — Tribe Product Design Lead. Led product design across 15+ squads in Odds Tribe; partnered with engineering & product leadership; mentored designers to senior/lead; established design as a decision-making partner.

ING Bank (2017–2022) — UX Principal Expert / Chapter Lead. Built UX chapter for Business Banking from scratch; co-created scalable design system foundations; drove digital transformation of legacy platforms; facilitated design reviews and cross-squad collaboration.
Deloitte Digital CE (2015–2016) — UX Manager. Led enterprise-scale design projects; balanced client expectations with team delivery.
UseLab (2011) — UX Director. Managed client projects in usability and UX research.
Komitywa.com (2007–2009) — Managing Director & Co‑Founder. Ran one of Poland’s earliest UX agencies; built and led a team of usability experts.

Grey/Argonauts (2003–2006) — Project Manager / UX Lead. Established Poland’s first professional usability lab; conducted pioneering usability tests for Volkswagen Bank; evangelized evidence-based design.
Earlier roles — Wprost Online (2000–2003), Radio Zet (Jazz Reviewer), Forum Publishing (Journalist).

ING Business — SME/MC Permission Management. Challenge: complex access & authorization causing support load. Approach: personas, journey mapping, IDIs, Design Studio, prototype testing. Solution: contextual workflows and natural language questions replacing legalese.
Outcome: improved adoption, reduced support costs, higher task success rates, stronger stakeholder alignment.

BanqUP / Solarisbank — Purely Digital Bank. Role: owned leadership activities, guided design direction, ensured actionable outcomes; designed UX for customizable financial services across desktop and mobile.
Challenge: deliver personalization at scale for SMEs. Onboarding personal yet efficient; blend analytics, integrations, and widgets to optimize operations.

Approach: human‑centered design — research, co‑creation, rapid prototyping, iterative validation; tagging & organizational tools; smart analytics for transactions; dashboards and widgets for connected apps.
Outcome: improved adoption, reduced support, higher task success; tailored SME experience balancing simplicity and flexibility.

Bank BPH — Digital Conversion Transformation. Redesigned end‑to‑end digital conversion paths; workflow design, wireframing, conversion optimization; improved onboarding and transactions in regulated environment.

Warta.pl — InsurTech Service Design Overhaul. Discovery interviews, workshops, journey mapping; streamlined car insurance quote funnel via progressive disclosure and smart defaults; iterative usability testing.

PKO Bank Polski — iPKO Biznes Corporate Redesign. 18‑month transformation; 3‑month discovery with interviews and workshops; defined design systems and enterprise workflows; cross‑functional alignment.
Telecom projects — T‑Mobile (e‑shop conversion paths), Plus.pl (full redesign 2008), TP SA (multiple product flows). Focus on usability at scale and conversion.
Media projects — Cyfrowy Polsat (portals), Polska Times (content aggregation for 16 local titles), TVP (large‑scale IA, accessibility, portals).
Leadership & Philosophy — managing tribe/chapter models; coaching designers into leads; designers coding and engaging with AI; multidisciplinary collaboration; stakeholder buy‑in.
Leadership Playbook — Org Models & Embedding: tribe/chapter; dual reporting (craft leadership + squad alignment); interfaces between Design, Product, Engineering.
Discovery & Delivery Balance — shift‑left discovery; continuous discovery with delivery; playbooks: IDIs, diary studies, JTBD interviews.
Design Ops & Systems — scalable design systems, governance, Figma libraries, tokens, accessibility; shared language across teams; contribution models.
Research Ops — centralized research repos; standardized recruitment and templates; democratization of research (enable PMs/engineers to observe and co‑analyze).
Quality & Feedback Loops — design critiques and rituals; review systems; metrics for design quality: adoption, usability scores, support tickets.
AI & Future‑Forward — integrate AI‑assisted tools; use LLMs to synthesize research; explore agentic AI to automate parts of design ops.
AI Builder Phase (2022–Now) — hireverse.app (AI interviews recruiters); personal RAG for design knowledge; MCP server for AI meeting intelligence; advocacy: senior designers should code.

Keywords: UX strategy, design leadership, stakeholder alignment, user research, prototyping, information architecture, design systems, B2B SaaS, accessibility, conversion optimization, service design, mentoring, team leadership.
